programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: Once again it was time for the VLN Endurance Racing Championship. While the drivers were doing their test laps, we had a look behind the scenes and explored what went on in the pit lanes.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The fourth race of the VLN season is usually regarded as a dress rehearsal for the 24-hour race. For the top teams and best drivers it is the last opportunity for a really thorough test.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: We present the highlights of last week. The 24 hour race was exciting, as usual. In addition, we explored the 'Strong Man Run' and took a look at the tourist drivers

programme.title: BMW 503
programme.desc: The noble four-seater 503 convertible was one of BMWs most exclusive models in the 1950s. Many international sports and movie stars and other wealthy customers were fond of this sporty luxury vehicle.

programme.title: Volvo S90
programme.desc: It looks sportier than one might expect from the Swedes. The taillights frame the powerful looking rear. On the inside, the Volvo S90 impresses with the finest materials and soft nappa leather.

programme.title: Alfa Romeo 6C 2500SS
programme.desc: Founded in 1910, the iconic Italian car manufacturer Alfa Romeo experienced a very eventful history. Their 6C 2500 SS model is right in the middle of the company's more than 100-year history. It combined new technology with an early post-war appearance.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: With the GTR, Nissan tried to take on the established European sports car manufacturers. For less than half the price the GTR was a more affordable direct competitor to Porsche's 911 Turbo S or the Audi R8 GT. In addition: one of the ultimate super cars, the Techart 911 Turbo S with 620 hp. And: the Pagani Huayra, presented and driven by Formula 1 Pilot Adrian Sutil.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: It's not always a car's pure power that makes driving through curves exciting. The Subaru BRZ with its low boxer engine and its well-balanced handling gives his driver a very good feeling for the road. The BMW 235i RS has a great rear wheel performance and the Porsche Cayman GTS with its mid-engine puts a smile on your face as soon as you put your foot on the accelerator.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: With the creation of its i8, Munich-based car manufacturer BMW makes a big step towards the future. After all, the futuristic looking car is the first German sports car which utilizes hybrid technology. Supercars checks out the BMW i8 on the streets of Los Angeles. But BMW did not just work on the i8. They also present the new sports coupe 435i and the sporty SUV X550d M.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: If you have only sat in the back of a big limousine and if you don't know how much these kind of limousines are, you are probably part of the management. When it comes to driving experience and performance, it makes sense that the driver¿s seat is less attractive. But that's only the case for seasoned state cars anyways. The Audi RS and Mercedes S-Class might even make some chauffeurs unemployed.

programme.title: McLaren 570 GT
programme.desc: Onboard the McLaren 570 GT on the island of Tenerife

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Since the 1950s, the Mercedes-Benz SL has been regarded as the sports car legend par excellence. Beginning with the legendary 300 SL with its gullwing doors, the SL series stands for innovation and cultivated sportiness.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang is the icon of all sports coupes and convertibles - no other car conveys so much the lifestyle of the 1960s. With its striking shape and powerful engines the Mustang drove itself into the hearts of millions.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: The Beatles, Peter Sellers, Britt Ekland or the British royals, they all drove the Austin Mini. Designed on a napkin, the Mini starts an incredible career in 1959: the revolutionary Mini is considered the prototype of all small cars.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: A car that everyone knows and that almost everyone has ridden in, a car that has conquered all continents and bears an unmistakable nickname, the Volkswagen Beetle.

programme.title: Car History
programme.desc: Ferrari - the name alone raises the pulse. No other sports car has as much magic and myth as the fiery red icons from Maranello. Whether on the road or on the race track, these cars are the centre of attention.

programme.title: Facel Vega Facellia
programme.desc: In the late 1950s, the Facel Vega Facellia was designed to compete with Porsche and Alfa Romeo and open a new market segment for the fledgling French luxury car company.

programme.title: Saab 93 and Saab 99 Turbo
programme.desc: In 1937 an airplane manufacturing company was founded in Sweden that later became the famous car manufacturer Saab. We present two of their iconic car models, the Saab 93 and 99 Turbo.

programme.title: Beradino
programme.desc: A „bella macchina“, a beautiful car - but not designed by masters like Bertone or Pininfarina. Johannes Paulussen from Neuss in Germany built the Beradino by hand.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Normal is not enough. Tuning is a way of life for many car fans - the search for ever more horsepower, better sound and extraordinary design.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: The Monza Rally Show is a classic among drift shows. Plus: a Mercedes G-Class becomes a special off-roader 'ORC Bull'. And: a Mini Countryman becomes a Dakar Rally competitor.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: Porsche is like a religion! The faiths: Punk, technology and racing. Porsche punk Magnus Walker preaches individualism for historic vehicles. Technology has been embodied by Alois RUF since 1983. And for the racers, there is the GT3 RS.

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: BMW tries to combine the electric future with fuel-saving features in the i8. In addition: the 'Race Chip' is tested on a 3,000-kilometre route. And: What is the benefit of the switchable performance enhancement from DTE Systems?

programme.title: Tuning
programme.desc: They are the US car icons par excellence: Chevy, Ford Mustang and Corvette. At Race 61, fans of historic racers pay homage to their heroes. And: we explore the history of the Ford Mustang up to the current model.

programme.title: Harley-Davidson Trio
programme.desc: We took a look at three very different Harley-Davidson models. The versatile Switchback Dyna, the motorized wheelie bike Sportster 72, and the bad-boy motorcycle Softail Slim.

programme.title: Volvo Laplander 6x6
programme.desc: More extremes are always possible. Volvo's Laplander army vehicle has 6 wheels, 3 axles and provides space for at least 12 soldiers.

programme.title: Ken Block - Gymkhana Grid
programme.desc: Spectacular drifts are to be expected when Ken Block visits the Gymkhana Grid.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Since its introduction in 1983 the Opel Combo has been very successful with both craftspeople and families alike. We took a look at the updated version. Also: with the XC40, Volvo introduced a new mobility concept called Care by Volvo.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Porsche packed a lot of power into the Panamera. We took their Sport Turismo model to the Formula One track in Bahrain. In addition: BMW redesigned their 530i Touring 4-cylinder station wagon. And: an trip to Cologne in the Volvo V60.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Beside SUVs, compact and city cars are on the rise. For many people, a Kia Picanto is enough to satisfy their mobility needs. In addition: the Audi A1 offers certain features of the luxury class, but at a much higher price. And: the agile Kia Ceed GT.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army. Its shape won’t win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Cadillac CTS-V
programme.desc: Those who don’t know about it will only see a dignified sedan but under the hood hides the 649 horse power 6.2 liter V8 supercharged engine of the Corvette Z06. This car is a good alternative to the Audi RS6, BMW M5 and Mercedes E63 AMG.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.desc: The Pikes Peak Hill Climb is a rather unique type of car race in the mountains of Colorado, USA. It's exciting, tough and dangerous, and in 1987, two-time world rally champion Walter Röhrl took his Audi Sport Quattro S1 to the top.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.desc: In the 1930s the famous Silver Arrows by Auto Union that were designed by Ferdinand Porsche celebrated great successes at the European Drivers' Championship and several Grand Prix races despite the strong competition by Mercedes-Benz.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.sub-title: Rallye Year 1972 - A Ford success story
programme.desc: The International Championship for Manufacturers was a rally series which was run from 1970 to 1972. Car manufacturers such as Porsche, Renault, Opel and Ford took part in this competition, with Ford having an exceptionally successful year in 1972.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Bentley Mulsanne EWB
programme.desc: The long version of the Bentley Mulsanne is a prime example of a chauffeured limousine. With it, the British luxury car brand has set the bar extremely high when it comes to automotive comfort.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Mitsubishi Outlander Plug-In Hybrid, the world's first hybrid SUV with two electric motors and a 2-liter combustion engine. Also: the Chevrolet Silverado, an American full-size pickup with a V8 and an average consumption of at least 15 liters.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Bentley EXP 9F and Jaguar C-X17 are concept cars the two manufacturers presented before they started making their own luxury SUVs. Also: how did Toyota, Nissan or Subaru see the future of the SUV? And: Mercedes-Benz' Unimog concept car.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The SUVs Nissan X-Trail and BMW X4 aren't typical offroaders. We witnessed the presentation of the new X-Trail model and BMW's premiere of their X4. Also: the Steinbeißer Trophy, where unusual offroad vehicles take part in a demanding rally.

programme.title: BMW M3
programme.desc: In the late 80s BMW brought a car onto the market which carried true racing genes. Initially conceived as a homologation model for the German Touring Car Championship, it developed into being one of the world's hottest street sports car. Whenever its name is mentioned, car fans feel goosebumps - even today: the BMW M3.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Volvo XC60
programme.desc: The Swedish landscape is characterized by mountains, forests and lonely roads. Ideal for this off-roader. The Volvo XC60 scores with many safety features and a cool appearance.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: With the M3, BMW brought race car technology to the road. In addition: 120 years of Mercedes-Benz motorsports history. And: turbo power in the DTM. The Ford Sierra RS Cosworth taught its racing competition the meaning of fear.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The year 1964 marked Opel's foray into the upper class market. The company presented its KAD series with the Kapitän, Admiral and Diplomat models, combining US design with solid German technology.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: The BMW 507 Roadster was cherished by superstars like Elvis Presley. Today, the 150 HP sports car from 1955 is one of the most valuable classics of all time. Also: following the footsteps of the iconic Porsche brand in a 356 Cabrio.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: Cars like the Ford GT 40, the Jaguar D-Type or the Mercedes 300 SL wrote history on the race track and now break records at auctions. A sumptuously restored 300 SL will start at the most famous classic car rally in the world, the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Classic Ride
programme.desc: We followed the restoration of the unique Bayer K67 research vehicle, the first all-plastic car in the world, developed in 1967 by the pharmaceutical giant Bayer.

programme.title: Lancia Stratos HF
programme.desc: The Lancia Stratos with Ferrari power, the rally icon of the 1970s.

programme.title: BMW 328 Schlüter
programme.desc: If a car arrives in a trailer, its value is usually very high. The original BMW 328 Schlüter is already rare and expensive. But this model is a reconstruction and it is absolutely unique.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: Audi set new standards with their RS5 Coupe. Also: the Erzberg Rodeo is one of the toughest enduro races in the world. We show highlights from the 2012 event. And: the Suzuki Kizashi 4x4 and the Mercedes-Benz GL.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The Ariel Atom is a street-legal sports car that provides ultimate acceleration and maximum cornering speed. Also: the third-generation Audi A3 on the roads of Mallorca. And: the Mini John Cooper Works Roadster and the fifth-generation Chevrolet Camaro.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: With the GT86, Toyota want to create a sports car that builds upon the glory days of the company's success model Celica. Also: Audi TT RS vs. Mercedes-AMG SLK 55. And: the Techart GT Street R, a souped-up Porsche 911 Turbo.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: Peugeot introduced an updated version of their 208 success model, and there is also a rally version named R2. Also: how far can to go in a Volkswagen Polo BlueGT? And: the Freestyle Festival Swatch Free4Style.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: Nissan's and Datsun's Z model range of cars is for the Japanese what the Porsche 911 is for Germans. Also: the Porsche Cup 2011 at Nürburgring. And: Audi A7 vs. Mercedes-Benz CLS 350.

programme.title: Lamborghini Huracan by O.CT
programme.desc: A lot of power thanks to a compressor. This optimized O.CT Lamborghini Huracán delivers over 800 horse power to get the blood flowing.

programme.title: Rimac Concept One
programme.desc: The futuristically designed Rimac Concept One is one of the fastest, most powerful and expensive electric cars in the world, it does not adhere to convention.

programme.title: Jaguar XJR
programme.desc: The highlight of the XJR lies beneath the hood: all of Jaguar's top models are equipped with the 5-liter V8 compressor engine that delivers 550 HP in this sports sedan.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Since its introduction in 1983 the Opel Combo has been very successful with both craftspeople and families alike. We took a look at the updated version. Also: with the XC40, Volvo introduced a new mobility concept called Care by Volvo.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Porsche packed a lot of power into the Panamera. We took their Sport Turismo model to the Formula One track in Bahrain. In addition: BMW redesigned their 530i Touring 4-cylinder station wagon. And: an trip to Cologne in the Volvo V60.

programme.title: Perfect Ride
programme.desc: Beside SUVs, compact and city cars are on the rise. For many people, a Kia Picanto is enough to satisfy their mobility needs. In addition: the Audi A1 offers certain features of the luxury class, but at a much higher price. And: the agile Kia Ceed GT.

programme.title: Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10
programme.desc: The Toyota MegaCruiser BXD10 has its origins in the Japanese army. Its shape won’t win any beauty contests or achieve the best results in the wind tunnel, but this is not really the point with an SUV like this.

programme.title: Cadillac CTS-V
programme.desc: Those who don’t know about it will only see a dignified sedan but under the hood hides the 649 horse power 6.2 liter V8 supercharged engine of the Corvette Z06. This car is a good alternative to the Audi RS6, BMW M5 and Mercedes E63 AMG.

programme.title: Classic Races
programme.desc: The Pikes Peak Hill Climb is a rather unique type of car race in the mountains of Colorado, USA. It's exciting, tough and dangerous, and in 1987, two-time world rally champion Walter Röhrl took his Audi Sport Quattro S1 to the top.
